intro: Myosotis nohetii, commonly known as the New Zealand forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its small, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Myosotis nohetii has lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, clustered blooms during the spring and summer months. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in its native habitat.
